dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3854 IH: Manufacturing Partnership Improvement Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Garamendi (for himself and Mr. Pocan) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology

form.official-title: To amend the National Institute of Standards and Technology Act relating to the Hollings Manufacturing Extension Partnership to provide for enhanced representation on the Advisory Board, better assist United States-based small manufacturers and exporters, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Manufacturing Partnership Improvement Act.

section.header: Manufacturing Extension Partnership Advisory Board; small manufacturers and exporters

subsection.text: Section 25 of the National Institute of Standards and Technology Act (15 U.S.C. 278k) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subclause (II), by striking and after the semicolon;
in subclause (III), by striking the period and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new subclause:

subclause.text: at least 1 member shall represent 1 or more labor organizations (as such term is defined in section 2 of the National Labor Relations Act (29 U.S.C. 152))—

item.text: that is a national or international labor organization subject to section 401(a) of the Labor-Management Reporting and Disclosure Act of 1959 (29 U.S.C. 481(a)) with members who are direct production employees in manufacturing establishments, as determined by the Director; or

that participates in 1 or more training programs registered under the Act of August 16, 1937 (popularly known as the National Apprenticeship Act; 29 U.S.C. 50 et seq.), for a highly skilled trade in manufacturing, as determined by the Director.

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking and after the semicolon;
in subparagraph (C), by striking the period and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:
to the greatest extent practicable, establish partnerships between each Center and the nearest—

clause.text: regional or district offices of the Small Business Administration to provide training and guidance with respect to the application process for loans guaranteed by the Small Business Administration;
regional or district offices of the Economic Development Administration of the Department of Commerce to provide guidance in accessing relevant Federal assistance for manufacturing;
regional offices of the Department of Labor to assist in workforce development for manufacturing; or

U.S. Export Assistance Center established by the United States and Foreign Commercial Service of the Department of Commerce pursuant to section 2301(b)(8) of the Export Enhancement Act of 1988 (enacted as part of the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988 (15 U.S.C. 4721(b)(8))).

subsection.text: The National Institute of Standards and Technology Act is amended—

clause.text: by redesignating the second paragraph (7) (relating to the definition of the Hollings Manufacturing Extension Partnership or Program), and paragraphs (8) through (11), as paragraph (8), and paragraphs (9) through (12), respectively; and
in paragraph (8), as so redesignated, by striking established under subsection (n) and inserting established under subsection (m);
in subparagraph (D), by striking and after the semicolon; and
in subparagraph (E), by striking the period and inserting a semicolon; and

subparagraph.text: in subsection (m)(5)(B), by striking and describe through section 23 (15 U.S.C. 278i); and
in subsection (e)(2)(B)(iv)(I), by inserting a before renewed; and

clause.text: in subparagraph (I), by inserting and after the semicolon;

subclause.text: by inserting that are before additional programs; and
by striking ; and and inserting a period; and
